person.persName: William Hercules Hays (Colonel of the 10th Kentucky Infantry and Inspector General of Kentucky)

body.p: Kentucky attorney, solider, and judge. Washington County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Hays and Eleanor Burcham Hays. Educated in Washington County, Kentucky schools. Read law in Elizabethtown, Kentucky under James W. Hays and attended law lectures in Glasgow, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1845. Attorney in Springfield, Kentucky, in 1850. Elected county judge of Washington County in 1851 and in 1854. Elected as a member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1861. Lieutenant colonel and colonel of the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from 1861 to December 6, 1864. Inspector general of Kentucky from March to November 1865. Owned twenty-seven enslaved persons in 1850. Owned thirty enslaved persons in 1860.
